cmCourseInfo.description: An interdisciplinary and intersectional approach to the study of disability and sexuality. Students will engage with historical, mainstream and critical discourses and explore complex issues and representations pertaining to disability, sexuality, sexual practices and desire. Draws from a range of writings and cultural texts in queer, crip and sexuality studies.
cmCourseInfo.title: Sexuality & Disability
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: SDS255H1/SDS256H1 (UNI255H1/UNI256H1) or NEW240Y1/CSE241Y1 or permission of the Instructor
cmCourseInfo.exclusionsText: SDS455H1 (Special Topics in Sexual Diversity Studies: Sexuality & Disability), offered in Fall 2015
